author: James Joyce
text: Dear Mr Rodker: As I could not find any flat in Paris we are staying in this maison meublée. My case of books has at last arrived. Could you send me the Little Review for September and October 1919? Has any number appeared since the July-August number of this year? I mean has any part of Oxen of the Sun been published? I have received letters from New York concerning a prosecution. Have you received any letters from the New York editor? I should like to know before I reply. Kind regards from us all to Mrs Rodker and yourself Sincerely yours James Joyce
